intro: Asprella ovata, commonly known as the white-flowered asprella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in racemose inflorescences. Asprella ovata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
